wikipedia_page.main: Hampton Carroll Gleeson (31 August 1834 – 10 April 1907) was a pastoralist and politician in the young colony of South Australia. He was later involved in the business of brewing beer in the neighbouring colony of New South Wales.

link_mentions.page: Members of the South Australian House of Assembly, 1870–71

response: *Hampton Gleeson (1834–1907), Australian miner, pastoralist, politician and brewer
